DataElement.preferredName: Hodgkin's Lymphoma Diseases and Disorders Allogeneic Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Performed Present Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field to specify the type of Hodgkin's Lymphoma, a previously known as Hodgkin's disease, characterized by the presence of Reed-Sternberg cells, identified as the primary abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person specified as the reason for a clinical treatment in which HSC capable of reconstituting the immune system and blood production (hematopoiesis) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hodgkin's Lymphoma Diseases and Disorders Allogeneic Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Performed Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to Hodgkin's Lymphoma, a previously known as Hodgkin's disease, characterized by the presence of Reed-Sternberg cells, as the primary abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person specified as the reason for a clinical treatment in which HSC capable of reconstituting the immune system and blood production (hematopoiesis) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A lymphoma, previously known as Hodgkin's disease, characterized by the presence of Reed-Sternberg cells.  There are two distinct subtypes: nodular lymphocyte predominant Hodgkin's lymphoma and classical Hodgkin's lymphoma.  Hodgkin's lymphoma has a bimodal age distribution, and involves primarily lymph nodes.  Current therapy for Hodgkin's lymphoma has resulted in an excellent outcome and cure for the majority of patients. -- 2003:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: A lymphoma characterized by the presence of relatively few malignant cells called Reed-Sternberg cells and mononuclear Hodgkin cells that are admixed with nonneoplastic inflammatory cells. The malignant cells have a distinctive immunophenotype; they are positive for CD30 and CD15 and negative for CD3, CD20, and CD45.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredName: Allogeneic Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Performed Present
Property.preferredDefinition: A clinical treatment in which HSC capable of reconstituting the immune system and blood production (hematopoiesis) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another. The donor and recipient may or may not be related. 2005:Performed; carried out.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: A clinical treatment in which hematopoietic stem cells (HSCs) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another.
Executed and carried through to completion.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).
